sailpoint.object

Class BaseAttributeDefinition

  • java.lang.Object
    • sailpoint.tools.xml.AbstractXmlObject
      • sailpoint.object.BaseAttributeDefinition
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    java.io.Serializable, sailpoint.tools.xml.PersistentXmlObject
    Direct Known Subclasses:
    Argument, AttributeDefinition, Field, ObjectAttribute

    public abstract class BaseAttributeDefinition
extends AbstractXmlObject
    The fundamental properties required for the definition of an attribute.
    See Also:
    Serialized Form

        See Also:
        Constant Field Values

      • _categoryName

        protected java.lang.String _categoryName
        Arbitrary name used to group related attributes into categories. This was added to provide some organization for ObjectAttributes, specifically those for roles. In retrospect it probably belongs in ObjectAttribute but it could be used in other contexts.

      • _allowedValues

        protected java.util.List<java.lang.Object> _allowedValues
        List of allowed values. Typically these are strings.

      • _required

        protected boolean _required
        Flag indicating that a value for the attribute is required.

    • Constructor Detail

      • BaseAttributeDefinition

        public BaseAttributeDefinition()

    • Method Detail

      • getName

        public java.lang.String getName()
        Canonical name of the attribute. Though not required, this is typically formatted in camel case with no spaces. This will be the map key used in attribute value maps.

      • setName

        public void setName(java.lang.String name)

      • getDisplayName

        public java.lang.String getDisplayName()
        An alternate display name to use in the UI. This can also be a message catalog key.

      • setDisplayName

        public void setDisplayName(java.lang.String name)

      • getDisplayableName

        @Deprecated
public java.lang.String getDisplayableName()
        Deprecated. Please use the BaseAttributeDefinition.getDisplayableName(java.util.Locale) method below.
        Return the displayable name (localized using the system default Locale if it is a message key) or the name of this attribute if there is no display name.

      • getDisplayableName

        public java.lang.String getDisplayableName(java.util.Locale locale)
        Return the displayable name (localized using the given Locale if it is a message key) or the name of this attribute if there is no display name.

      • getType

        public java.lang.String getType()
        The type of value that will be kept for this attribute. This value should be one the TYPE_ constants or in some contexts the name of a SailPointObject subclass.

      • setType

        public void setType(java.lang.String type)

      • isMulti

        public boolean isMulti()
        True if the attribute can be multi-valued. This is not required though it can be used to cause an attribute value being assigned to automatically be wrapped in a List.

      • setMulti

        public void setMulti(boolean b)

      • isMultiValued

        public boolean isMultiValued()
        Alternate accessor for the "multi" property, used by older connectors.

      • setMultiValued

        public void setMultiValued(boolean b)

      • getDescription

        public java.lang.String getDescription()
        Optional long description for the attribute.

      • setDescription

        public void setDescription(java.lang.String description)

      • getCategoryName

        public java.lang.String getCategoryName()

      • setCategoryName

        public void setCategoryName(java.lang.String categoryName)

      • isRequired

        public boolean isRequired()

      • setRequired

        public void setRequired(boolean required)

      • getDefaultValue

        public java.lang.Object getDefaultValue()

      • setDefaultValue

        public void setDefaultValue(java.lang.Object defaultValue)

      • getAllowedValues

        public java.util.List<java.lang.Object> getAllowedValues()

      • setAllowedValues

        public void setAllowedValues(java.util.List<java.lang.Object> val)

      • isType

        public boolean isType(java.lang.String type)
        Type tester assuming a default type of String.

      • isComplex

        public boolean isComplex()
        Quick complexity tester.

      • assimilate

        public void assimilate(BaseAttributeDefinition src)
        Assimilate another attribute definition into this one. This is used for the conversion of ObjectAttributes into AttributeDefinitions for the application editing UI.

      • getAllowedOperations

        public java.util.List<Filter.LogicalOperation> getAllowedOperations()
        Gets LogicalOperations allowed for this attribute, based on the type and whether or not the attribute is multi-valued.
        Returns:
        List of LogicalOperations allowed for this attribute.
